CD007049BB6C46A3BC914CC663AEDC11.description:
Research and communicate information to describe how data from technologies (e.g.,
telescopes, satellites, space probes, seismographs) provide information about Earth and objects
in space and how those scientific discoveries have in turn led to improved technologies.

EA9962BE1E604B818FAD576812310BEB.description:
Links Among Engineering, Technology, and Applications of
Science

39E4D166030145E2BE137398B11EA238.description:
Use a model of a device that incorporates an electromagnet to test solutions to a design
problem with specific criteria and constraints.

567FA8A0B56947928736AD1A1E98B6E6.description:
Collect data, map, and describe patterns in the locations of volcanoes and earthquakes related
to tectonic plate boundaries, interactions, and hotspots in order to forecast the locations and
likelihoods of future events.

4AE03D81406E4FE2BD22BA1E6D392DEE.description:
Construct a scientific explanation using data that explains the gradual process of plate tectonics
accounting for (a) the distribution of fossils on different continents, and (b) continental and
ocean floor features (i.e., mountains, volcanoes, faults, and trenches).

BC4FB6DE910343C2A399A8C68C6E87DB.description:
Gather and evaluate evidence that energy from the earth's interior drives convection cycles
within the asthenosphere which creates changes within the lithosphere including plate
movements, plate boundaries, and sea-floor spreading.

A4B26BD18D3E4179B93E115BE1543AF5.description:
Evaluate data collected from seismographs to create a model of Earth's structure and to
understand how energy is derived from Earth's hot interior.

35093BCC08554A7E9D4895D4C5C29D9A.description:
Analyze and interpret data to support the assertion that rapid or gradual geographic changes
lead to drastic population changes and extinction events.

FE84A01DDA21490DB6C130E2774D60DE.description:
Research, analyze, and communicate that the universe began with a period of rapid expansion
using evidence from the motion of galaxies (i.e., redshift and blueshift), elemental
concentrations of hydrogen and helium, and cosmic background radiation.

60C8F308DA304F9A9105047604DA9731.description:
Obtain, evaluate, and communicate information about the technologies that have changed the
way humans use artificial selection to influence the inheritance of desired traits in other
organisms.

C988B7E4629E420D99F6204285D37096.description:
Develop a scientific explanation of how natural selection plays a role in determining the survival
and reproduction of a species in a changing environment.

CA0483FFC3B846A29DB15AC3E55B0B4E.description:
Construct an explanation based on evidence that explains how genetic variations of traits in a
population increase some individuals' probability of surviving and reproducing.

F02D6AEFEA4047958BB5D55BAA04B64A.description:
Construct an explanation addressing similarities and differences of the anatomical structures
and genetic information between extinct and extant organisms using evidence of common
ancestry and patterns between taxa.

935584818D484AADA312173F17B9A80F.description:
Using evidence from the geologic timescale, analyze and interpret data for patterns in the fossil
record that document the existence, diversity, extinction, and change in life forms throughout
Earth's history.

71D85B4D82544672BB54CA8A3DCE0A06.description:
Engage in argument from evidence to support the claim that digitized signals, sent as wave
pulses, are more reliable than analog signals to transmit information in a system.

1AE99EA0871347CD9557A25C97172873.description:
Construct explanations from observed patterns of wave behaviors to compare and contrast
mechanical waves and electromagnetic waves based on refraction, reflection, transmission,
absorption, and their behavior through a vacuum and/or various media.

284FCE966AAF4946AFF3B8FE7D07E08A.description:
Develop and use models to represent the basic properties of waves in a system including
frequency, amplitude, wavelength, and speed.

AF37E61F1C1A440A8A3371C6CEA28A8E.description:
Waves and Their Applications in Technologies for Information
Transfer

D8A0B6A880384711ACE0C7DEFFEFF74E.description:
Evaluate and interpret that for every force exerted on an object there is an equal force exerted
in the opposite direction.

CEC62CB821F64675AB5F7128EFE03CC9.description:
Plan and conduct an investigation to provide evidence that the change in an object's motion
depends on the sum of the forces on the object and the mass of the object.

A1C97829A70A4EFD9C8CF314AF83B1E3.description:
Construct an explanation to describe why the position and motion of object(s) in a system, and
the effects of forces on those objects, vary with respect to the observer.

F9228D93ED9A491FB713DE6F190EBED1.description:
Construct an argument using evidence to support the claim that gravitational interactions in a
large-scale system (e.g., galaxies and solar system) are attractive and depend on the masses of
and distance between interacting objects.

BA10A12195434966A480E3AC3BA21E2C.description:
Ask scientific questions about data to determine how manipulating variables can increase or
diminish the electric current and magnetic field strength in electromagnets, generators, and
electric motors.

43DCF6CC252D45DBA476D139A7FBBBD5.description:
Conduct an investigation to provide evidence that the size of force fields (electric and magnetic)
depends on the magnitudes of the charges, current, or magnetic strengths involved and the
distances between interacting objects.

3DA8E5D3129E4B0082BB2721FC6CBD64.description: Motion and Stability: Forces and Interactions

96762350E33A4F8A8A4442DDDA7B88D1.description:
Develop a model to explain how the light coming from distant stars and the formation of
heavier atoms is the result of changes in the composition of the nucleus of the atom and the
energy released during the process of nuclear fusion.

D05857B5622F4EF4B15D0DC59B4DB5A6.description:
Use a model to understand that atoms are a system composed of a positively charged nucleus
surrounded by one or more negatively charged particles called electrons.
